title: UBS posts $1.14 billion profit in second quarter, smashing expectations
content: Analysts expected revenue of $11.5 billion, according to an LSEG poll.
summary: Analysts expected revenue of $11.5 billion, according to an LSEG poll.

title: Japan Prime Minister Fumio Kishida will not run for party reelection
content: Kishida's decision to not run for reelection effectively means he would step down as prime minister when the party elects a new leader.
summary: Kishida's decision to not run for reelection effectively means he would step down as prime minister when the party elects a new leader.

title: Video game industry faces sluggish growth in 2024 amid weak console sales, research firm says
content: Market research firm Newzoo said the games industry is set to grow 2.1% year over year, down from its earlier forecast of 2.8% year-over-year growth.
summary: Market research firm Newzoo said the games industry is set to grow 2.1% year over year, down from its earlier forecast of 2.8% year-over-year growth.

title: Wednesday's big CPI inflation report could mark a change in thinking for the Fed
content: The news Tuesday was good for inflation, and investors hope it will get even better Wednesday.
summary: The news Tuesday was good for inflation, and investors hope it will get even better Wednesday.

title: Intel sells stake in UK chip designer Arm amid company-wide restructuring and cost cuts
content: Intel has sold its 1.18 million stake in British chip firm Arm Holdings, a regulatory filing showed on Tuesday, as the company cuts costs.
summary: Intel has sold its 1.18 million stake in British chip firm Arm Holdings, a regulatory filing showed on Tuesday, as the company cuts costs.

title: Reserve Bank of New Zealand cuts cash rate by 25 basis points, lowers rate forecasts
content: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand lowered its cash rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% on Wednesday.
summary: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand lowered its cash rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% on Wednesday.

title: Asia-Pacific markets mixed as RBNZ cuts cash rate; Nikkei rises as Kishida to step down in September

title: We drove Chinese EVs to see why rival automakers are worried

title: Monaco is 1 of 6 locations hosting the star-studded E1 — a race thought ‘impossible’ before it began

title: India launches app to lower deaths caused by wild elephants

title: Why Wall Street thinks Brian Niccol is the person to revive Starbucks — and end the Howard Schultz era
content: Starbucks tapped Brian Niccol as its latest CEO, effective Sept. 9, after sales slumped under Laxman Narasimhan.

title: Chipotle stock falls as CEO Brian Niccol leaves for Starbucks
